DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluates the pharmacokinetic profile of levetiracetam in critically ill patients who have suffered a subarachnoid hemorrhage. The patients will be evaluated for development of augmented renal clearance and the effects and duration of effects this may have on levetiracetam clearance.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Augmented Renal Clearance on Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Properties of Levetiracetam in Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
DOC.criteria: Patients diagnosed with nontraumatic subarachnoid hemorrhage requiring levetiracetam for seizure prophylaxis or treatment Presentation to University of Colorado Hospital within 48 hours of subarachnoid hemorrhage Adults ages 18 to 89 years Anticipated length of stay ≥ 48 hours Informed consent provided by the patient or patient's designated medical proxy Pregnancy Patients receiving renal replacement therapy Brain death or imminent brain death expected ≤48 hours Patient with history of nephrectomy or renal transplant
